sentence.Network_en: They were killed by an avalanche in the Swiss Alps.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们在瑞士阿尔卑斯山的一次雪崩中罹难.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 18th cent.: from French, alteration of the Alpine dialect word lavanche (of unknown origin), influenced by avaler 'descend'; compare with Italian valanga

entry.def: An avalanche is a large mass of snow that falls down the side of a mountain.
You can refer to a very large quantity of things that all arrive or happen at the same time as an avalanche of them.

example.ex: The newcomer was greeted with an avalanche of publicity.
example.tran: 新来者受到了广泛的关注。

means.word_mean: 1. a slide of large masses of snow and ice and mud down a mountain
2. a sudden appearance of an overwhelming number of things;

sentences.sentence: "the program brought an avalanche of mail"

means.word_mean: 1. of snow masses in the mountains

auth_sentence.content: We no longer are facing an avalanche of job losses.
auth_sentence.res_content: We no longer are facing an avalanche of job losses.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: We no longer are facing an avalanche of job losses.

auth_sentence.content: We did not have an avalanche of complaints.

auth_sentence.content: The Nazis let loose an avalanche of laws and decrees.

sentences.en: He was swept away in an avalanche.
sentences.cn: 他在一次雪崩中被卷走了。

sentences.en: We received an avalanche of inquiries.
sentences.cn: 人们纷纷来电或来函查询, 我们实在应接不暇。

sentences.en: Higher still the snow was ready to avalanche.
sentences.cn: 在更高处积雪随时都会崩塌。

means.word_mean: (因大量涌至而)把...淹没,使无法应付

sentences.cn: 她收到多得无法应付的请帖。
